payload.title: Add task details modal in Dashboard TUI on Enter key
payload.description:
FEATURE: Add task details modal/dialog to Dashboard TUI that displays full task information when user selects a task and presses Enter.

USER STORY:
As a user navigating the Dashboard TUI with arrow keys (j/k), I want to press Enter on a highlighted task to see its full description and details in a modal, so I can read the complete task information without leaving the dashboard.

CURRENT BEHAVIOR:
- Dashboard allows task navigation with j/k or arrow keys
- Tasks are highlighted with magenta background
- No way to see full task details from dashboard
- User must exit and run 'gitgov task show <taskId>'

DESIRED BEHAVIOR:
- When a task is selected (highlighted), pressing Enter opens a modal
- Modal shows: title, description, status, priority, tags, references, notes, cycle IDs
- Modal can be closed with ESC or q key
- Modal is centered and properly styled with borders
- Long descriptions are scrollable or wrapped

IMPLEMENTATION:
1. Add modal state: const [showTaskModal, setShowTaskModal] = useState(false)
2. Add Enter key handler in useInput hook
3. Create TaskDetailModal component that receives selected task
4. Pass selectedTask to modal (find from sortedTasks by selectedTaskId)
5. Modal renders with Box + borderStyle + scrollable description
6. Add ESC/q handlers to close modal

FILES TO MODIFY:
- packages/cli/src/components/dashboard/DashboardTUI.tsx (add modal state, Enter handler, Modal component)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:
âœ… Pressing Enter on highlighted task opens modal
âœ… Modal displays full task information (title, description, status, priority, tags, etc.)
âœ… Modal can be closed with ESC or q
âœ… Modal is properly styled and centered
âœ… Long descriptions are readable (wrapped or scrollable)
âœ… Closing modal returns to dashboard with same selection
âœ… Works in all dashboard views (row-based, kanban, scrum)
